[b]Hack Forum News is back this week with another update on the weekly news to keep you up to date on the latest news on site and around the world. If you have never heard of Hack Forum News, dont worry we have you covered. We are a team of members from the Hack Forums community who are journilists and writers, and we are here to keep you in the loop of the changes around the site and now even around the world.[/b]

[u][b][size=large][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6302553][color=#ffffff]Moving Forward And Recent Events[/color][/url][/size][/b][/u] By [mention=1]
Omniscient announces recent changes to HackForums, including the removal of some long-time members, as part of a new direction for the community. The aim is to create a more visionary, productive space, even if that means upsetting some people along the way. Omniscient acknowledges that change can be uncomfortable but believes it's necessary for real progress. Remaining members are encouraged to contribute ideas, skills, and passion to help shape HF‚Äôs future.

[u][b][size=large][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6302361][color=#ffffff]Userbars Aliens vs Cosmic[/color][/url][/size][/b][/u] By [mention=1]
Last week, we reported on Omniscient updating the userbars on HackForums. This week, the evolution continues as Omniscient has launched a community poll to decide between two fresh userbar themes - Aliens and Cosmics. So far, the Aliens design appears to be the favorite among voters, but the final result is still to be determined.

[u][b][size=large][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6302843][color=#ffffff]Group Convo Rooms[/color][/url][/size][/b][/u] By [mention=1]
Omniscient is currently working on converting Group Convo Rooms (GCRs) to function more like the old Public Convo Room (PCR), including displaying only the latest 20 messages for context instead of storing full chat logs. Due to database limitations, notifications won't be implemented. The focus is instead on bringing back fun features like /flip and /rain. Omniscient also warns that Socket-based features (Convos and Notices) may be unstable during development.

As always, we appreciate the community‚Äôs contributions to the HackForums News by submitting reports you believe are newsworthy. We encourage you to do so by visiting the thread linked above. Thank you from the HF News Team.

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Devastating flash floods in Texas[/color][/size][/b][/u]

Central Texas has been hit by severe storms causing flash floods that have killed at least 129 people (including 27 children), left over 160 missing, and inflicted an estimated $18‚Äì22‚ÄØbillion in damages. The disaster, linked to climate change and federal forecasting cuts, has reignited debate over national resilience.

[b][url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/jul/14/monday-briefing-the-toxic-cocktail-of-climate-denial-federal-cuts-and-the-texas-floods]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Trump announces 30‚ÄØ% tariffs on EU & Mexico[/color][/size][/b][/u]

[b][url=https://www.reuters.com/business/trump-announces-30-tariffs-eu-2025-07-12]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Major U.S. weapons support for Ukraine[/color][/size][/b][/u]

[b][url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/whats-news-world-wide-450b1fe0]Source[/url][/b]

[color=#FF5F54][b]NVIDIA's GeForce RTX 5050[/b][/color]
NVIDIA has officially launched the GeForce RTX 5050 GPU at a budget friendly price. This card has the most up to date technological advancements in GPU for this generation making it a "smart" GPU. AI acts as a smart multiplier for your graphics card's power. It allows a $249 card to deliver a fast, smooth, and graphically-rich gaming experience that, until very recently, was only possible with much more expensive, high-end hardware.
Desktop versions at $249
Laptop versions at $999

[color=#72FF84]Notable News (July 2025)[/color]

[color=#FF5F54][b]Call of Duty Remote Code Execution (RCE) exploit[/b][/color]
Highly Vulnerable as of today 7/13/25: Call of Duty: WWII
Last week we touched on this subject in the COD community. RCE exploits are still a problem, and it's not an overnight fix. Here are some recommended tips for dealing with this situation.

Stop playing immediately: Do not launch or play any online modes for Call of Duty games listed on your PC. Do not assume you are safe in private matches.
Await official confirmation: The only safe source of information is from the official Call of Duty or Activision social media channels and their support websites. Do not trust rumors or unofficial sources.
Do not download unofficial fixes: Be extremely cautious of any third-party downloads claiming to be a "patch" or a "fix" for this exploit. These are very likely to be malware themselves. Only install updates directly through Battle.net or Steam.
Check your system: While there is no evidence of widespread attacks yet, it is good practice to run a full antivirus scan on your computer if you have played any of these games in the last few days.
